items.summary: Generate unique Bitcoin receive addresses for each authenticated user that can receive native BTC on-chain
Update transaction history recording to distinguish between wrapped ICRC-1 transfers and native on-chain conversions
Generate unique Ethereum receive addresses for each authenticated user that can receive native ETH on-chain
Generate unique Solana receive addresses for each authenticated user that can receive native SOL on-chain
Display the user's unique Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana receive addresses on the Receive page alongside the existing Principal address
Add a transfer mode selector to the Send page allowing users to choose between 'Wrapped (Fast & Cheap)' and 'Native On-Chain' when sending ckBTC, ckETH, or ckSOL
Implement backend method to convert ckBTC to native BTC and send to an external Bitcoin address using chain-key Bitcoin integration
Implement backend method to convert ckETH to native ETH and send to an external Ethereum address using chain-key Ethereum integration
Implement backend method to convert ckSOL to native SOL and send to an external Solana address using chain-key Solana integration
Update the Send page to handle native on-chain transfers when the 'Native On-Chain' mode is selected, calling the appropriate chain-key conversion method
